Adds a column showing a label for the summary statistics shown in each row

add_stat_label.Rd

Rather than simply printing the summary statistics, with the use of add_stat_label(), a column labeling the summary statistics is added.

add_stat_label(x, iqr = TRUE)

Arguments

x

object with class fmt_table1 from the fmt_table1 function
iqr

logical indicator whether 'q1, q2' and 'p25, p75' should resolve to 'IQR'. Default is TRUE

Examples

mtcars %>% fmt_table1() %>% add_stat_label()
#> 
#> Variable             Statistic            N = 32              
#> mpg                  Median (IQR)         19.2 (15.4, 22.8)   
#> cyl                                                           
#> 4                    n (%)                11 (34%)            
#> 6                    n (%)                7 (22%)             
#> 8                    n (%)                14 (44%)            
#> disp                 Median (IQR)         196 (121, 326)      
#> hp                   Median (IQR)         123 (96, 180)       
#> drat                 Median (IQR)         3.70 (3.08, 3.92)   
#> wt                   Median (IQR)         3.33 (2.58, 3.61)   
#> qsec                 Median (IQR)         17.71 (16.89, 18.90)
#> vs                   n (%)                14 (44%)            
#> am                   n (%)                13 (41%)            
#> gear                                                          
#> 3                    n (%)                15 (47%)            
#> 4                    n (%)                12 (38%)            
#> 5                    n (%)                5 (16%)             
#> carb                                                          
#> 1                    n (%)                7 (22%)             
#> 2                    n (%)                10 (31%)            
#> 3                    n (%)                3 (9.4%)            
#> 4                    n (%)                10 (31%)            
#> 6                    n (%)                1 (3.1%)            
#> 8                    n (%)                1 (3.1%)            
mtcars %>% fmt_table1(by = "am") %>% add_stat_label(iqr = FALSE)
#> 
#> Variable             Statistic            0                    1                   
#>                                           N = 19               N = 13              
#> mpg                  Median (Q1, Q3)      17.3 (14.9, 19.2)    22.8 (21.0, 30.4)   
#> cyl                                                                                
#> 4                    n (%)                3 (16%)              8 (62%)             
#> 6                    n (%)                4 (21%)              3 (23%)             
#> 8                    n (%)                12 (63%)             2 (15%)             
#> disp                 Median (Q1, Q3)      276 (196, 360)       120 (79, 160)       
#> hp                   Median (Q1, Q3)      175 (116, 192)       109 (66, 113)       
#> drat                 Median (Q1, Q3)      3.15 (3.07, 3.70)    4.08 (3.85, 4.22)   
#> wt                   Median (Q1, Q3)      3.52 (3.44, 3.84)    2.32 (1.94, 2.78)   
#> qsec                 Median (Q1, Q3)      17.82 (17.18, 19.17) 17.02 (16.46, 18.61)
#> vs                   n (%)                7 (37%)              7 (54%)             
#> gear                                                                               
#> 3                    n (%)                15 (79%)             0 (0%)              
#> 4                    n (%)                4 (21%)              8 (62%)             
#> 5                    n (%)                0 (0%)               5 (38%)             
#> carb                                                                               
#> 1                    n (%)                3 (16%)              4 (31%)             
#> 2                    n (%)                6 (32%)              4 (31%)             
#> 3                    n (%)                3 (16%)              0 (0%)              
#> 4                    n (%)                7 (37%)              3 (23%)             
#> 6                    n (%)                0 (0%)               1 (7.7%)            
#> 8                    n (%)                0 (0%)               1 (7.7%)
